content:
Sure, here are five more ideas for the proposal with a phygital experience:

1. "The Unity Tree": A giant interactive tree sculpture that encourages visitors to write messages of unity and hope on paper leaves and hang them on the tree. The tree will also have augmented reality features, allowing visitors to scan the leaves and see them come to life in 3D animations and videos.
2. "Family Wellness Trail": An interactive trail featuring physical activities and wellness stations for families to explore together. Each station will have a QR code that visitors can scan with their phones to access educational videos and information about the benefits of the activity.
3. "Youth Time Capsule": A digital and physical time capsule created by and for youths. Visitors can contribute digital messages, photos, and videos to be included in the capsule, which will be sealed and displayed at the exhibition. The capsule will also have an augmented reality feature, allowing visitors to see what the capsule might look like when it's opened in the future.
4. "Heritage Memory Booths": Interactive booths where visitors can record and share their family's stories and memories. The booths will also have augmented reality features, allowing visitors to see 3D models of objects and artifacts related to their stories.
5. "Celebrating Diversity Wall": A large interactive wall featuring images and stories of diverse communities in Singapore. Visitors can contribute their own stories and photos, and the wall will also have augmented reality features, allowing visitors to see 3D models of the different cultural artifacts and symbols.
